channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large advertising board obscuring view of junction., 21st February
item.description:
I don't know whether this advertising board has been authorised by the council. I find it obscures my view of oncoming traffic when waiting to pull out at the crossroads. It may cause an accident.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beaconsfield Road, Elmstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned and vandalised metal box needs removal, 21st February
item.description:
This metal had not been used for more than 30 years and needs removal as it is used to store and distribute drugs. Please raise this matter with the CEO of the Council and remove it. It has been reported many times with the excuse that belongs to a cable company. Just remove it please!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lordship Lane, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temporary manhole cover on damaged manhole for over 8 months, 21st February
item.description:
A bright yellow manhole cover appeared last year and no workmen have been to repair it ever since. I suspect it is a telecoms manhole but not sure. Its gets dangerously slippery in icy conditions and is a trip hazard as it has raised edges.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Berkeley Avenue, West Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped white cabinet on the pavement, 21st February
item.description:

item.title: Vandalism to bikes in cycle storage, 21st February
item.description:
As per other reports about the cycle storage here, my bike has now been vandalised. Please contact me to discuss a proper solution to the overuse and lack of security here. This is a car free development and so we are completely dependent on the storage.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Well Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ash tree growing horizontally across pavement and roadway towards top of Romney Drive, 21st February
item.description:
The tree is dangerously distorted with much of the trunk horizontal. Its weight will cause it to fall, especially as it is being affected by ash die-back, which is prevalent in the area. It is a particular danger to children travelling to and from Scott’s Park Primary School. Although the Council said no action was necessary when this issue was reported in 2025, a tree surgeon attending for other work nearby emphasised the danger this month.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Romney Drive, Elmstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree down outside 69 stembridge se20 7ue, 21st February
item.description:
Tree blown down between 9 am and 10.15 am saturday 21st february 2026. Now blocking half the pavement, nursery school one end of the road, primary school the other. Reported by susan barrett 71 stembridge.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stembridge Road, Anerley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
